name: Full Queue Developer
items: Featured in [iOS Dev Weekly](https://iosdevweekly.com/issues/563#tools)!
Built [Haptics Studio](https://apps.apple.com/app/id1624792731) using SwiftUI, which helps you discover the perfect customized haptics for your app
Answer viewers' programming questions
Consistent schedule of every weekday at 2pm NYC time.

name: Daring Bit Assembly
items: Aided in their client project by porting open source framework away from Realm to GRDB.
Objective-C interacting with new Swift code.
Worked quickly to meet their client's deadline, updating frequently

name: Stash
items: Tech-lead for a referral rewards program across backend, web, Android, and iOS
Mentored colleagues learning to develop on iOS.
Experimental social financial site at crew.stash.com using React & Ruby on Rails
Converted monolithic services to microservices, using Ruby on Rails, Kafka, HTML/CSS and Docker
iOS developr ependency management using Mint, Cocoapods, & Xcodegen
Native iOS screens and architecture for onboarding overhaul

name: GrowFlow
items: Embedded GrowFlow's existing webapp into a `WKWebView` with native login screen
Coordinated on-device capabilities such as BlueTooth and local storage to enable their React webapp to connect and reconnect to receipt and label printers.
Integrated native Zebra and Star Micronics SDKs to print over BlueTooth, USB, and WiFi from iPad.
Converted PDFs to native CoreGraphics bitmaps to print receipts and package labels

name: Stash
items: Took ownership of investigating a launch bug that involved AppsFlyer and concurrent threads which resulted in potential 10 second launch times. The fix I architected and implemented resulted in a ~10% increase in registrations.
Braze, Mixpanel, Apptimize, AppsFlyer, and Branch integrations.
Migrated from Branch to AppsFlyer

name: CoinMarketCap
items: Built first iOS app according to the provided designs.
Implemented currency conversion and currency formatting.

name: Stash
items: Massive iOS app rewrite from Objective-C with MVC architecture to Swift with VIPER architecture with improved testability.
Coordinated across with development and business teams to codify the rules around purchase logic, implementing them in Fitnesse tests.

items: Added usuability features to existing Objective-C camera app
Migration off Parse to new vendor due to Parse end-of-life

name: Sifftr

items: Led team of one developer and one designer

name: uSTADIUM

Users of the app loved the changes!

name: Blinkbuggy

name: Cyrus Innovation LLC.
